summary: Millions of Americans are unsure about where their next meal will come from. Meanwhile, about 40% of the U.S. food supply goes uneaten. This issue requires action across the food supply chain and collaboration among federal and state agencies, businesses, communities, and more. Federal agencies announced an interagency plan to cut food waste in half by 2030. But the plan doesn't indicate agreement on agency...
title: Food Loss and Waste: Building on Existing Federal Efforts Could Help to Achieve National Reduction Goal
